description: Learn about physical and mental well-being, nutrition, and healthy living

questions.question: How many hours of sleep does the average adult need per night?
questions.funFact: Humans are the only mammals that willingly delay sleep!
questions.story: The recommendation for 7-9 hours of sleep comes from extensive research by the National Sleep Foundation. During sleep, the brain performs crucial maintenance tasks, including clearing out toxic proteins that build up during waking hours. This 'brain cleaning' process was only discovered in 2013.

questions.question: What is the main function of vitamin D?
questions.funFact: Your body can produce vitamin D when your skin is exposed to sunlight!
questions.story: Vitamin D was discovered in the early 1920s during research on rickets, a bone disease common in children. The discovery that sunlight could prevent and treat rickets led to the fortification of milk with vitamin D, which virtually eliminated the disease in many countries.

questions.question: What is mindfulness?
questions.funFact: Studies show that people spend 47% of their waking hours thinking about something other than what they're doing!
questions.story: Mindfulness has roots in Buddhist meditation practices dating back over 2,500 years. It was introduced to Western medicine by Jon Kabat-Zinn in the 1970s through his Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction program, which has since been scientifically proven to reduce anxiety and depression.
